title: a68-diversion-a1-closes-high-sided-vehicles-due-winds
story: THE A has closed to high-sided vehicles after wind speeds of up to mph were recorded.Drivers of high-sided vehicles, motorbikes, caravans, and cars with trailers or roof boxes should ert via the A, according to the road officials.A red weather alert is currently in placefor parts of Scotland ndash including coastal areas of the Borders ndash with the Met Office warning of the possibility of ldquoexceptionally strong winds.:Borders woman banned from road for  months after driving while disqualiedTommy Deans, BEAR Scotlandrsquos network manager for south east Scotland, said: ldquoWersquove now closed the A to high-sided vehicles for safety with winds gusting over mph.ldquoAll road users are advised to take care and check for restrictions before travel. If we experience the very high wind speeds that are forecast later today, this will result in a full closure of the A.ldquoPlease check Traffic Scotland for the latest travel advice before setting off and consider whether your journey is essential.

title: greystone-knowe-14-turbine-borders-wind-farm-plans-filed
story: PLANS for a -turbine wind farm in the Borders have been filed with the council.The Greystone Knowe development ndash around . km west of Fountainhall ndash is a joint venture between ESB and Coriolis Energy, according to papers submitted as part of the application.Scotlandrsquos current climate change ambitions has been given as a reason for the proposed turbines, which would have a maximum tip height of m.Documents submitted to the council state: ldquoThe UK and Scotlandrsquos current climate change ambitions are amongst the highest in Europe. The Scottish government declared a climate emergency in May  and has recently passed the Climate Change Bill which has passed into law the requirement for a  per cent reduction in CO emissions by  and an interim target of  per cent reduction in emissions by .ldquoLooking beyond to , the Scottish Energy Strategy target for  per cent of total energy demandfrom renewable sources implies a further substantial increase in delivery required.ldquoAs such, the Scottish Government looks to encourage all renewable and low carbon solutions for meeting the energy target.On the location, the report adds: ldquoThe Greystone Knowe project area has not formed a part of any previously proposed onshore wind development and has the capacity to make a valuable contribution to national policy aims.ldquoIn addition, experience in the local community now indicates that the shared benefits of wind energy development can make a valuable contribution towards local community needs through community benefit funds as well as investment and employment during construction.If approved, the turbines would be the biggest of the operational wind farms within km of the site.According to the papers, there are three developments within that radius.Carcant, near Heriot, has three turbines with a maximum height of m, while Oxtonrsquos Toddleburn has  turbines with the tallest at m. The turbines at Longpark wind farm, near Stow, stand at a maximum of m, the report states..removeIf approved, the turbines would be a matt grey colour.The papers add: ldquoAlthough off-white has been an accepted colour for turbines, more recently constructed wind turbines have been a mid grey tone, which reduces the distance over which turbines are visible, especially in dull weather or low light conditions.

title: garvald-west-linton-new-building-only-way-meet-clients-needs
story: A BORDERS care provider says a new accommodation block is the ldquoonly way it can meet the needs of its clients.Plans for the ldquopurpose-built structure on the Garvald House estate, West Linton, have been submitted to Scottish Borders Council.Garvald West Linton provides residential accommodation for adults with learning dficulties across a mix of modern and listed buildings.And the charity is now proposing to develop a new detached residential building for six residents.A report attached to the application states that: ldquoThe needs of the client group have changed over recent years. We now have clients with more complex needs.ldquoWhat is meant by complex needs is that alongside a cognitive impairment there are also underlying medical conditions.ldquoThe age profile of our client is also increasing with over half of the client group now in their s.It adds: ldquoWe need to improve our accommodation to manage this ever-increasing level of need. Much of the accommodation is over two levels and, for those with mobility issues, we need to have level access accommodation.ldquoWe also need to provide improved levels of privacy leading to the creation of en-suite facilities for each client.ldquoIt has come into sharp focus that some of the current buildings do not meet modern standards of infection control. Examples would be the lack of staff changing facilities and the number of clients sharing toilet facilities.ldquoWe anticipate that this will be a regulatory requirement in the near future.ldquoThe increased level of need has seen the requirement for increased attendance space and storage of mobility equipment.Garvald West Linton currently provides care to  people with learning disabilities.The proposed site is located away from Garvald House so as to not adversely affect the ldquosetting, character and appearance of the B-listed building.The ground levels will need to be adjusted to accommodate the development, according to the report, giving an opportunity to ldquotuck the new building into the landscape..removeIf approved, each resident will have their own flat with an en-suite bedroom, living room and kitchen.A shared living dining room, accessible bathroom, multi-use space, kitchen, laundry, storage space and plant room will also be provided.A managerrsquos office and staff accommodation are included in the plans.

title: omicron-variant-spreads-countries-world-alert
story: The Omicron iant of the coronavirus has appeared in an increasing number of European countries, leaving governments around the world scrambling to stop the spread.The UK on Saturday tightened its rules on mask-wearing and on testing of international arrivals after finding two cases.New cases were also confirmed in Germany and Italy, with Belgium, Israel and Hong Kong also reporting that the iant has been found in travellers.In the US, Dr Anthony Fauci, the governmentrsquos top infectious diseases expert, said he would not be surprisedthe Omicron iant was already in the country.vw,vw,px, px"There are concerns the Omicron iant is more transmissible than the Delta iant ldquoWe have not detected it yet, but when you have a virus that is showing this degree of transmissibility hellip it almost iniably is ultimately going to go essentially all over, Dr Fauci said on NBC television.Because of fears that the new iant has the potential to be more resistant to the protection offered by vaccines, there are growing concerns around the world that the pandemic and associated lockdown restrictions will persist for far longer than hoped.Nearly two years since the start of the pandemic that has claimed more than  million lives around the world, countries are on high alert.Many have already imposed travel restrictions on flights from southern Africa as they seek to buy time to assess whether the Omicron iant is more transmissible than the current dominant delta iant.In England, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said it was necessary to take ldquotargeted and precautionary measures, such as increased mask-wearing, after two people tested positive for the new iant.He told a news conference: ldquoRight now this is the responsible course of action to slow down the seeding and the spread of this new iant and to maximize our defences.The British government also added four more countries mdash Angola, Malawi, Mozambique and Zambia mdash onto the countryrsquos travel red list from Sunday..removeSix others mdash Botswana, Eswatini , Lesotho, Namibia, South Africa and Zimbabwe mdash were added on Friday.Many countries have slapped restrictions on ious southern African countries over the past couple of days, including Australia, Brazil, Canada, the EU, Iran, Japan, New Zealand, Thailand and the US, in response to warnings over the transmissibility of the new iant.This goes against the advice of the World Health Organisation , which has warned against any overreaction before the iant was thoroughly studied.Despite the banning of flights, there are mounting concerns that the iant has already been widely seeded around the world.Italy and Germany were the latest to report confirmed cases of the Omicron iant.An Italian who had travelled to Mozambique on business landed in Rome on November  and ed to his home near Naples.He and five family members, including two school-age children, have since tested positive, the Italian news agency LaPresse said. All are isolating in the Naples suburb of Caserta in good condition with light symptoms.Italyrsquos health ministry is urging all regions to increase its tracing of the virus and sequencing to detect cases of the new iant first identied in South Africa.In Germany, the Max von Pettenkofer Institute, a Munich-based microbiology centre, said the Omicron iant was confirmed in two travellers who arrived on a flight from South Africa on November .vw,vw,px, px"The Omicron iant was first detected in South Africa The Dutch public health institute said the Omicron iant was ldquoprobably found in a number of the tested persons who were isolated after arriving on Friday in Amsterdam on two flights from South Africa.The institute said in a statement that further sequencing analysis is underway to determine for sure that it is the new iant. The results were expected on Sunday. A total of  people were tested.Israel said it detected the new strain in a traveller who had ed from Malawi and was tracing  travellers who ed recently from southern African countries.And Australia said on Sunday its scientists were working to determine whether two people who tested positive for Covid after arriving from southern Africa are infected with the Omicron iant.The iantrsquos swt spread among young people in South Africa has alarmed health professionals even though there was no immediate indication whether the iant causes more severe disease..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Omicron iant spreads to more countries as world on alert

title: israel-tightens-travel-restrictions-new-covid-variant
story: Israel has approved barring entry to foreign nationals and the use of controversial technology for contact tracing as part of its efforts to crack down on a new coronavirus iant.The Health Ministry said in a statement that the countryrsquos coronavirus cabinet has authorised a raft of measures, including red-listing travel to  African countries, banning entry by foreigners, and mandating quarantine for all Israelis arriving from abroad.It also approved use of the Shin Bet internal security agencyrsquos controversial phone monitoring technology to perform contact tracing of iniduals confirmed with the new Omicron iant of coronavirus in Israel.vw,vw,px, px"Israel said it detected the new Omicron iant in a traveller who had ed from Malawi Israeli rights groups had decried the use of the mobile phone monitoring technology as a violation of privacy rights, and the Supreme Court ruled earlier this year that its use must be limited.Dr Ran Balicer, head of the governmentrsquos advisory  on Covid-, told Israelrsquos Kan public radio that the new measures are necessary for the ldquofog of war surrounding the new iant, saying it is ldquobetter to act early and strictly to prevent its spread.On Saturday, Israel said it had detected the new strain in a traveller who had ed from Malawi and was investigating seven other suspected cases. The seven people included three vaccinated iniduals and all were placed in isolation.Scientists say the new coronavirus iant, first detected in South Africa, is a concern because of its high number of mutations and rapid spread.Israel, a country of . million people, has reported at least , deaths from coronavirus since the start of the pandemic.Most of the population ndash more than . million people ndash have received at least one dose of the Pfizer BioNTech vaccine, and more than  million Israelis have received a booster.The country has more than , active cases,  of them in a serious condition in hospital, according to Health Ministry statistics..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Israel tightens travel restrictions over new Covid iant

title: australia-confirms-two-omicron-cases-travel-curbs-tightened-across-world
story: Australian officials have confirmed that two overseas travellers arriving in Sydney tested positive for the Omicron iant of the coronavirus, as nations around the world tightened controls against the worrying new strain.The two passengers were among a group of  who arrived in Australia from southern Africa on Saturday. Both were asymptomatic and vaccinated against Covid-. The remaining  have been placed in quarantine.Neighbouring New Zealand announced it is restricting travel from nine southern African countries because of the threat posed by the iant, and Japan widened its border controls to include more countries from the region.Tourist-dependent Thailand, which only recently began loosening its tight border restrictions to leisure travellers from certain countries, announced a ban of its own on visitors from eight African counties.Similar restrictions took effect in the business hub of Singapore, which is barring entry and transit to anyone with a recent history of travel to seven southern African nations.vw,vw,px, px"The Omicron iant was first detected in South Africa Sri Lanka banned disembarkation of passengers arriving from six African countries due to the detection of the Omicron iant, as did the Males, the luxury Indian Ocean resort archipelago.Israel went further, barring entry to all foreign nationals, mandating quarantine for all Israelis arriving from abroad and red-listing travel to  African countries.It also approved use of the Shin Bet internal security agencyrsquos controversial phone monitoring technology to perform contact tracing of iniduals confirmed with the new iant.The tighter restrictions reflect steps rapidly taken by countries around the world to limit the spread of the Omicron iant just days after it was identied by researchers in South Africa.The ldquoact first, ask questions later approach reflects growing alarm about the emergence of a potentially more contagious iant nearly two years into a pandemic that has killed more than five million people, turned lives upside down, and disrupted economies across the globe..removeWhile much remains to be learned about the new iant, researchers are concerned that it may be more resistant to the protection provided by vaccines and could mean that the pandemic lasts for longer than anticipated.Cases involving the Omicron iant have already been confirmed on multiple continents, with Germany, Italy, Belgium, Israel and Hong Kong all reporting cases in recent days.David Hui, a respiratory medicine expert and government adviser on the pandemic in Hong Kong, said that even though it is not clearcurrent coronavirus vaccines are effective against the new iant, the cityrsquos vaccination rate should be increased and that ldquobooster doses should be implemented as soon as possible.He said the two people who tested positive for the Omicron iant had received the Pfizer jab and exhibited very mild symptoms, such as a sore throat.ldquoVaccines should work but there would be some reduction in effectiveness, he said.vw,vw,px, px"There are concerns the Omicron iant is more transmissible than the Delta iant The United Statesrsquo top infectious diseases expert, Dr Anthony Fauci, said he would not be surprisedthe new strain is already in the US too.ldquoWe have not detected it yet, but when you have a virus that is showing this degree of transmissibility hellip it almost iniably is ultimately going to go essentially all over, he said on NBC television.In Australia, the New South Wales health department said the infected travellers arrived from one of nine African countries that are now required to quarantine in a hotel upon arrival in Sydney ndash South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, Eswatini, Malawi and the Seychelles.New Zealandrsquos Covid- Response Minister, Chris Hipkins, said the island nation is taking a precautionary approach.From late on Sunday, only New Zealand citizens from nine African countries will be allowed entry, and they will be required to spend two weeks in a quarantine hotel run by the military.Mr Hipkins said officials are confident the iant has not entered New Zealand and they are well placed to keep it out.Many countries have slapped restrictions on ious southern African countries over the past couple of days, including Brazil, Canada, the European Union, Iran, and the US, in response to warnings over the transmissibility of the new iant.This goes against the advice of the World Health Organisation, which has warned against any overreaction before the iant has been thoroughly studied..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Australia confirms two Omicron cases as travel curbs tightened across the world

title: kevin-bridges-tour-2022-uk---full-list-dates-get-tickets-presale
story: Kevin Bridges has announced dates for his  UK tour,The Overdue Catch-Up.The Scottish comedian will play six dates at the Glasgow Hydroas well as PJ Live inAberdeenand other venues around the UK.Making the announcement on his Facebook page of Friday morning, he said said: "Folkshellip The Overdue Catch-Up goes on sale next Friday,  December am." to my mailing list at www.kevinbridges for access to the presale on Wednesday,  December from am."Irsquoll see you about. Enjoy!"How to get tickets for Kevin Bridges  tour Tickets for Kevin Bridges The Overdue Catch-Up tour will go on sale at am on Friday December  .You can access the presale tickets by signing up to the Kevin Bridges mailing list atwww.kevinbridges.Presale tickets will go on sale at am on Wednesday December .Tickets for the Newcastle, Manchester andCardf shows are also on sale via Live Nation.Kevin Bridges  UK tour dates and venuesFriday,  July : Liverpool, Empire TheatreSaturday,  July : Liverpool, Empire Theatre Thursday,  July : Newcastle,  City Hall Friday,  July  : Newcastle,  City Hall Saturday,  July : Newcastle,  City Hall Sunday,  July : Newcastle,  City Hall Friday,  August : Plymouth, Pavilions                       Saturday,  August : Plymouth, Pavilions  Saturday,  August : Hull, Bonus Arena                     .removeFriday,  August : Sheffield, City Hall                       Saturday,  August : Sheffield, City Hall Friday,  August : Blackburn, King Georges Hall Saturday,  August : Manchester, O Apollo Sunday,  August : Manchester, O Apollo Friday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro Friday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro Saturday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro Friday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro  #Saturday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro Sunday,  September : Glasgow, OVO Hydro Saturday,  October : Aberdeen, PJ Live Friday,  October : Brighton, Dome                         Saturday,  October : Brighton, Dome Friday,  October : Cardf, Arena Saturday,  October : Swansea, Arena Friday,  October : Belfast, SSE Arena                      Saturday,  October : Belfast, SSE Arena  Wednesday,  October : Birmingham, Utilita Arena Friday,  October : Manchester, O Apollo Saturday,  October : Manchester, O Apollo Sunday,  November : Dublin, Arena Tuesday,  November : London, Eventim Apollo Wednesday,  November : London, Eventim Apollo Thursday,  December : London, Eventim Apollo Friday,  December : London, Eventim Apollo

title: put-christmas-tree
story: It may only be November, but people are already preparing for Christmas and maybe even thinking about putting up the tree.The date for putting up the Christmas tree tends to y from family to family, with some opting for an early start to the festivities, while others wait right until the last minute.But did you know theres a traditional date for putting up your tree Heres everything you need to know about when you should be putting up your Christmas tree...When should Iput my Christmas tree up According to tradition in the UKyou should put your Christmas tree up around the beginning of advent, which is four Sundays before Christmas.This yearadvent will start on November , however lots of people will choose to wait until December .Roman Catholic tradition on the other hand is at the other end of the spectrum - waiting until Christmas eve to put up the tree.The Queen finishes "dressing" her tree on Christmas eve, with all the members of the Royal family joining in as a festive family activity.While there are dferent traditions, it is of course completely up to you when you choose to put up your tree and start celebrating the festive season!What date should I take my Christmas tree down Again, according to tradition, you should take your tree down on the th day of Christmaswhich is January .The first day of Christmas is unsurprisinglyDecember  and traditionally is followed by  further days of celebration.January  marks the beginning of the Christian holiday Epiphany and superstition suggests it is "bad luck" to keep your decorationsup after this date.However last year many people around the country kept their Christmas lights up well into February to maintain some festive cheer during the post-Christmaslockdown.

title: world-cup-play-off-draw-date-time-watch
story: The WorldCup play offdraw takes place on Friday, which will determine which teams will go head to head for a spot in the Qatar  World Cup.Thanks to Scotlands win against Denmarkin their final Group F match, they are seeded for the semi finals and will therefore face one ofAustria, North Macedonia, Turkey, Poland, Ukraine or Czech Republic.And Scotlandarent the only UK-seeded side -Wales have also secured a seeded spot.With the play-offs taking place next March, the draw will help Steve Clarkes side to prepare for what lies aheadas they try to move one step closer to Dohas World Cup.Having made it through to the play-off stageof Euro  earlier this summer, the team will look to build on this experience and move forward to win those all-important seats on the plane to Doha.Heres what you need to know about the World Cup play offdraw on Friday...When is the World Cup play offdraw The World Cup play offdraw will take place in Zurich, Switzerland at the Fa headquarterson Friday November  at pm UK time.How to watch World Cup play offdraw The World Cup play off draw can be livestreamed on Fas official website on Friday afternoon.Coverage will start at pm.When will the World Cup play offs take place The World Cup play offs are set to take place in March .The twelve teams in the draw will be ided into three groups to play semis and finals.Semi final matches will be played on March - , and finals on March - .The three winners of these finals will then qualy for the World Cup.Which teams are seeded for the World Cup play offs Scotland, Portugal, Italy, Russia, Sweden and Wales are all seeded for the World Cup play offs.Who could Scotland face in World Cup play offs Scotland and the other seeded sides could be drawn against any of the following teams:AustriaNorth MacedoniaTurkeyPolandUkraineCzech Republic.removeWhen does the  Qatar World Cup start The  World Cup will start on November  , with the final taking place on December  .This is later in the year than usual due to extremely high temperatures in Doha in the summer.

title: world-cup-draw-channel-time-watch-play-off-draw-today

title: minato-sushi-cheese-lady-boost-haddington-town-centre
story: The Cheese Lady on Haddington High Street is moving into the former butcher premises of Colin D Peat on neighbouring Court Street.The move from High Street has opened the door for Minato Sushi to bring the Japanese delicacy to the town centre.The changing face of the town centre was welcomed by councillors Tom Trotter and John McMillan, with the new businesses set to open this summer.Jen Kerr, of Minato Sushi, stressed there was still plenty of work ahead at the business before the doors opened.The -year-old, of Port Seton, who will run the business with her boyfriend Tom Cuddy, described it as ldquoa real dream come true.She said: ldquoWe are really excited. It is quite a big town centre in East Lothian and has quite a erse mix of businesses there already. It seems nice and some people have been coming up and chatting to me and other shop owners have been quite friendly.Meanwhile, Svetlana Kukharchuk ndash The Cheese Lady ndash has ambitious plans for the former butchers having found a home for her business in the town nearly four years ago.She said: ldquoWe needed more space and wanted to expand so we can offer more space to our customers to shop more conveniently.ldquoWe want to mature our own cheeses and we are going to have a maturation room.ldquoAlso, Irsquom hoping to offer a few tables, which still needs to be confirmed with the council, where people can sit down and order a flight of cheese and a glass of wine.Svetlana, who previously had a business in St Andrews, moved to East Lothian in November  and opened her High Street shop.The business has proven a popular addition to the town centre, offering cheeses from throughout Europe, including Italy, France, Spain, Switzerland and Norway.Mr Trotter was pleased with the announcement regarding the two businesses.He said: ldquoWhoever thought a cheese shop in Haddington that, after this time, needed bigger premises  Thatrsquos fantastic.ldquoAnd it is incredible we are getting a sushi shop.Fellow ward member Mr McMillan was pleased with the level of interest from people looking to open up businesses in the town.He said: ldquoI think we are in a good place.ldquoWhen we were growing up, we did not know what sushi was!

title: youngsters-12-hour-non-stop-relay-boosts-walk-scott-foundation
story: Mary Kidd spent a day running, cycling, skipping and more in aid of the Walk With Scott Foundation.The -hour non-stop relay on May  has collected more than pound,, which will go to the Tranent-based charity.Proud mum Karen is secretary of the Walk With Scott Foundation, which was set up by after-dinner speaker Scott Glynn to mark his th birthday.Karen thanked everyone who sponsored her -year-old daughter, who also undertook a fundraiser for the charity last year during lockdown.Karen said: ldquoWe are all so very proud of Mary once again, with her amazingly crazy two fundraising events.ldquoMary has raised a fantastic pound, for the Walk with Scott Foundation and I know first-hand how much these funds are going to help others across our communities.Last year, the primary six pupil at Cockenzie Primary School completed a six-hour TikTok marathon, which raised pound, for the Walk With Scott Foundation.: Familys television appearanceThe success of the fundraiser even caught the attention of former Spandau Ballet and EastEnders star Martin Kemp and his son Roman. Mary and Karen were joined by dad Gordon and older sister Abbie on Martin and Romanrsquos Sunday Best TV show to discuss the success of the event.However, Mary was not content to put her feet up and was once again doing her bit for the good cause.Speaking ahead of the latest fundraiser, Mary said: ldquoThis year I want to double the time, and plan to do a -hour non-stop fun relay up and down our Lorimer Lane at the back of my house.ldquoIrsquom walking, running, skipping, hopping, jumping, scootering, cycling, skating, football dribbling, swing ball, space hopping and, of course, TikTok-ing!People can still sponsor Mary by going to uk.virginmoneygiving marysfunrelay

title: anxiety-covid-19-preventing-east-lothian-children-attending-school
story: Education chiefs say that while the majority of pupils in the county successfully ed to classrooms following closures, lockdowns had had a detrimental impact on some, with a ldquosmall cohort still unable to .And despite warning that schools would be living with the impact of the pandemic for years to come, education chiefs said that they had set a goal of ing to pre-pandemic attainment levels by the end of the current school year.A report to East Lothian Councilrsquos education committee on the Covid recovery by schools revealed that there were stillongoing issues.Committee members raised concerns about ongoing ventilation issues in classrooms, as pupils face another chilly winter with windows remaining open regardless of the weather.And it was revealed that the local authoritywas having to pull cleaning staff from other public services to cover a ldquosevere shortfall in cleaners to ensure schools remained open.Despite this, Nicola McDowell, head of education, told the committee that staff were hopeful pupils would be ready to take exams next year, with prelim plans already in place, as teachers were praised for their hard work.In her report to the committee, she said her departmentrsquos aspiration was that ldquoby the end of this session,attainment s to pre-pandemic levels.Scottish Government funding of pound.million has been allocated to the local authority to support recovery and will be used to tackle ldquolost learning.The committee was told that some children had fallen behind while others were still not in class.The report said: ldquoWhile most children and young people have managed toto in-schoollearning, there is still a small cohort whose anxiety has caused a barrier to their .ldquoSchool staff and staff from our inclusion and wellbeing service continue to work proactively with them and their families to ensure they aresupported and continue to learn.The number of children struggling with anxiety was not available, although it is understood it includes pupils across primary and secondary schools in the county.Dr Lynne Binnie, educational psychologist, told the committee that a team was in place to offer support to those who were struggling.She said: ldquoOur early intervention team which sits between education and child services has been operating for a few weeks and we are working to ensure we can use every bit of potential funding we can get to support our young people.The committee was told that it had been decided to continue with restrictions such as face masks for secondary school pupils and staff, and restricting visitors to schools after the October holiday, and that guidance had been confirmed by the Scottish Government this week.Education bosses have also decided to have no residential trips in this school year.Concern over the continued policy of opening windows and doors in classrooms to ventilate them in winter were raised.Councillor John Williamson asked what provisions the schools had to support a child whose parent either could not provide warm clothing or had forgotten.Warm clothingHe said: ldquoSome parents are not able to provide warm clothing ndash unfortunately it still happens ndash or they may be rushing out of the door and forget.However, Sarah Morgan, Pencaitland Primary School headteacher, told the committee: ldquoAt our school we have a range of pre-loved unorms available at any time which we can use to support any child who needs it and I am sure all schools have these pre-loved unorm banks as well.The report concluded that schools and pupils would be living with the impact of the pandemic ldquofor years to come.However, it added: ldquoSchools and the wider education service will do everything we can to mitigate this impact, learn the lessons of what has worked and what we need to improve and ensure that we continue to improve outcomes for all.Paul McLennan, East Lothian MSP and a councillor for the Dunbar and East Linton ward, said: ldquoThe Covid- pandemic has caused unprecedented challenges for all of us in East Lothian, but children and young people have undoubtedly been some of the most affected.ldquoThere is a growing body of evidence which suggests Covid- has had a signicant strain on the mental health and wellbeing of Scotlandrsquos children and young people.ldquoDisruption caused by lockdowns and levels of uncertainty around the future will have of course caused lasting impact.ldquoAs we move forward from this pandemic, supporting our children and young people with their mental health and well-being must continue to be a priority.Kenny MacAskill, East Lothian MP, added: ldquoLockdown has been hard on the young ndash normal le and even rites of passage restricted.ldquoItrsquos not simply in schooling but in le that itrsquos occurred.ldquoNo wonder many have struggled.ldquoSome restrictions need to remain for the wellbeing of all ages but especially the young, who are not invulnerable.ldquoBut additional support for those who have been facing dficulties and challenges is required and as much normality as is possible is required for all.

title: christmas-gifts-offer-haddington-farmers-market-saturday
story: Haddington Pipe Band and Clark Community Choir will also be providing entertainment at the market, which forms part of East Lothianrsquos Saltire Festival.A wide range of seasonal produce from beetroot and Brussels sprouts to pumpkin and parsnips will be on offer, as well as a range of meats, chutneys, pies and preserves.Local grower Letham Plants will have a selection of wreaths and seasonal plants, while there will also be handmade soap and locally designed screen prints.The Woodland Trust will be on hand to explain how trees can help combat the climate crisis in its Big Climate Fightback campaign.East Coast Buses will bring one of its vehicles to promote contactless travel and local bus services.The market will be running from am to pm on Court Street.

title: public-consulted-plans-meeting-centre-people-dementia-musselburgh
story: East Lothian Health and Social Care Partnership is working with Musselburgh Area Partnership, Dementia Friendly East Lothian, Open Arms Carers and Outside the Box to develop the new facility.A spokesperson for the project said: ldquoEveryone is invited to share their views on activities and supports for the meeting centre, and the things which are important to people living with dementia.Members of the public can speak to staff from Outside the Box near the box office at The Brunton todayuntil .pm and tomorrowfrom .am to .pm.They will also be at Musselburgh Library on Monday and next Wednesday from am to noon.For more information and ways to get involved, contact Sue Northrop, of Dementia Friendly East Lothian, by emailing sue@dfel.org.uk or phoning   .

title: east-lothian-schoolchildren-produce-special-film-screened-cop26-green-zone
story: Innerwick, Longniddry, Macmerry and Dunbar Primary Schools worked with D Fie Foe film company and well-known East Lothian musician David Trouton to create an environmentally themed animated film, featuring the childrenrsquos voices and artwork.Exploring the environment around them through lsquowalking storiesrsquo, the children helped to create the film ndash Sound Story ndash entirely outdoors.It was funded by East Lothian Youth Music Initiative, East Lothian Council Arts Service and Screen Scotland.COP, the United Nations climate change conference, took place in Glasgow earlier this month.The Green Zone was where the public, civil society, indigenous peoples, youth groups, charities, academics, artists and businesses could get their voices heard through a programme of events, workshops, talks and exhibitions.The film has also been shortlisted for the Scottish Youth Film Foundation Festival, and all  finalist films will be added to the Scottish National Library Moving Image Archive.Sound Story also featured as part of East Lothianrsquos  Harbours Festival in July.Councillor Jim Goodfellow, cabinet spokesperson for community wellbeing, said: ldquoCongratulations to our primary school pupils for creating this inspiring animation.ldquoA truly collaborative production between all involved and a fantastic way for our young people to get involved with a COP event.ldquoEast Lothian Councilrsquos Arts Service and Youth Music Initiative East Lothian provide opportunities for our schools to access high-quality arts experiences and creative projects such as this.ldquoI am delighted that this film has been shortlisted for the Scottish Youth Film Foundation Festival and is must-see viewing for all.Principal teacher Aileen Kelly and P pupil Euan Kelly, age , from Dunbar Primary School, attended the screening in Glasgow representing all the young filmmakers from East Lothian.Aileen said: ldquoThe screening in the IMAX cinema was super, and the quality of the films from all  finalists was incredible. We felt really privileged to be there, and to have been involved in something so worthwhile. We would like to thank Jonathan, Dave and Simonefor all their work with our school during the project.The pupils across the schools loved the experience of taking part and reported: ldquoWe thought it was awesome ldquoIt was great to see our own art work animated and we loved the voice over ldquoIt was exciting to see our name in the credits ldquoWe put so much effort in ldquoIt was really good and creative.The film can be viewed on YouTube at youtube watch vGl-sgqHmw

title: work-way-new-petrol-station-haddington
story: A metal frame for the development has been constructed at Haddington Retail Park, on the townrsquos western edge. The petrol station, which will also include a retail unit, was approved by East Lothian Council in October .The petrol station was proposed by Euro Garages Ltd EPICLtd.Haddingtonrsquos community council was among those asked for their opinion on the proposals.According to the planning officerrsquos report: ldquoThey have suggested that the developers should reduce the size of the convenience store attached to the petrol filling station as well as putting time restrictions on it until the potential impact of increased traffic flow and noise can be determined.ldquoConcern is also raised with regards to impact of the proposal on the vitality and viability of the town centre of Haddington.Chris McEwan, chairman of the community council, welcomed the addition of a new petrol station.He said: ldquoThere has not been good competition for fuel in Haddington since the Ideal Garage closed.ldquoAlthough I do think our local Jet garage is run by a local family, for consumers it will probably be a good thing.Euro Garages declined to comment on the project. It is currently unclear when the petrol station could open or who would operate the facility.Meanwhile, construction work on a neighbouring site ndash rumoured to be for a Starbucks drive-thru ndash is continuing.The site, to the east of the newly opened retail park, was originally earmarked for a pub restaurant but plans never materialised. Instead, a coffee shop with outdoor seating area, proposed by Euro Garages, was approved in April .

title: east-lothian-christmas-lights-switch-ons-2021-timings-locations
story: Dunbar, East Linton, Haddington, North Berwick and Tranent are among those bringing a little bit of sparkle to residents.Dirletonrsquos Christmas tree will be put in place today , although there is no official switch-on event planned.It will be a distanced occasion for North Berwick residents when the Christmas lights are turned on at a virtual event on Saturday.The townrsquos community council invited residents to send photos and videos of their favourite North Berwick memories of the past year, which have been collated in a short film to share on Saturday.The link to watch the video will be available on Saturday from pm via the community councilrsquos Facebook page. A Facebook account is not necessary.For residents in Prestonpans, the Woods familyrsquos annual Christmas lights display will light up the town on Saturday at pm.The lights at the home, at  Longdykes Road, will be on every evening, .-pm, until January .The owners added that visitors should expect added surprises at the switch-on.No plans have been confirmed for the townrsquos main Christmas lights switch-on.Festive spirit will fill Dunbar town centre on Sunday with the townrsquos ldquobiggest display of Christmas lights.More than three hours of entertainment will be offered on High Street ahead of the .pm switch-on.Coronavirus restrictions have impacted the volunteersrsquo plans this year, including the ability to fundraise.Despite that, Graham Adams, chairman of Dunbar Christmas Lights committee, said volunteers had been working hard throughout the year to ensure there was a display the town could be proud of. He said: ldquoI think it is something the town needs just for a pick-me-up.ldquoIt will be the biggest display we have ever had.Entertainment starts at pm when a street market and fun rides open.Dance Discovery will perform while a street ceilidh with Graeme Armstrong Ceilidh Band and Lutrek Live Statues is also planned.Dalkeith and Monktonhall Brass Band will play while Starz Entertainment will also be on High Street.At .pm, the Rev Suzie Garrard Fletcher, minister of the parish of Dunglass, will give a ministerrsquos welcome before George Robertson, who led Dunbarrsquos community resilience team, and Dunbar Primary School pupil Lucy Brown are on hand to switch the lights on.A spokesperson for the Christmas lights team said: ldquoWe kindly ask that all visitors take measures to ensure they remain safe and well.A lucky schoolgirl will have the honour of ensuring East Linton is basking in a festive glow on Sunday. Eve Sutherland, a P pupil at the villagersquos primary school, won a competition to design a poster for the Christmas lights committee.The lights will be switched on at pm at The Square.A spokesperson for the Christmas lights group was delighted to see the switch-onafter last yearrsquos Covid-related cancellation.They said: ldquoThere will be stalls from pm, including a tombola, lucky dip, face painting, a lsquowine or waterrsquo stall, and a raffle for a luxury hamper of Christmas goodies. There will be mulled wine, Prosecco, beer or soft drinks, entertainment from the community choir and a film for the children.ldquoAll proceeds will go to the Christmas lights fund. Come and support the villagersquos effort to brighten up the Christmas period.Festive spirit will come alive in Haddington on Sunday when its Christmas lights are switched on.A virtual switch-on, which will be shown live on Facebook, is planned as concerns remain in place about the coronavirus pandemic.A Christmas tree is already in place outside the Corn Exchange, with plans for a second tree to be located in the Nungate.Graham Samuel, from the townrsquos community council, said the switch-on would take place at .pm and encouraged people to watch on the Haddington Events Grouprsquos Facebook page.The community councillor praised the work of the townrsquos volunteers, led by Steve Gibson, who ensure Haddington is sparkling each festive season.Residents of Tranent will also be surrounded by magical lights and the sound of Christmas carols when the townrsquos Christmas tree is lit up on Sunday evening.Tranent and Elphinstone Community Councilrsquos Christmas tree switch-on takes place between pm and pm at Winton Place, with attendees being welcomed with the sound of carol singing from the Clark Community Choir.Alcohol-free mulled wine and mince pies will be available after the switch-on at Thomsonrsquos on High Street.A living Christmas tree in Longniddry has been planted in the village however, no official switch on or parade will take place. Instead, the lights will be switched on at pm on Wednesday by community councillors.Meanwhile, other communities will be switching on their lights the following weekend.In Gford, the switch-on event is next Fridayat pm at the village hall. On the same day, Wallyfordrsquos Christmas lights are switched on, with a parade leaving from the minersrsquo club at .pm.Aberlady residents are being encouraged to switch on their outdoor Christmas lights at the same time next Saturdayat pm. The light-up event will be filmed by drone and shared to social media.And next Sunday , Cockenzie and Port Setonrsquos Christmas tree lights are switched on at the townrsquos harbour, at a time to be confirmed.But in Musselburgh there will be no torchlight parade or official ceremony this year due to a hold-up with delivery of materials to repair some of the lights. Once these have been delivered, the lights will be switched on at a date to be confirmed.Plans are still to be confirmed for any switch-on event in Gullane.

title: knox-academy-pupils-fancy-dress-raise-money-children-need
story: Youngsters at Knox Academy ditched their school unorms for bright costumes and characters on Friday.Sue Cook, headteacher at the Haddington secondary school, said it was ldquolovely to see pupils dressed up.She added: ldquoThe theme of Children in Need this year is lsquoTogetherrsquo, and today we have certainly showed that spirit of community in coming together, having fun and raising awareness of this charity. Thank you to all who donated money to this amazing cause as this will make a dference to so many lives.On Monday, the headteacher revealed that the youngsters had collected a total of pound.She said: ldquoA huge thank you to all who donated or baked. Thanks to our S for organising.

title: special-christmas-lights-display-musselburgh-home-support-cash-kids
story: Mario and Susan DrsquoAmico, of Ferguson Drive, raised about pound, for the NHS Lothian Covid- Appeal last year with their festive show of multi-coloured seasonal lighting.This time, they have chosen to raise funds for Forth  Cash for Kids with their display, which features a Christmas tree and Santa Claus at their upstairs window.Forth  Cash for Kids is a grant-giving charity that helps children in need across Edinburgh, the Lothians, Fe and Falkirk.Its mission is to improve the lives of disadvantaged children and young people who are affected by illness, poverty, neglect or who have additional needs.The charity works with local grassroots organisations that aim to make a dference to young lives, and supports families who often have nowhere  to go through its regular grant rounds.Supporters can donate by way of a bucket outside the couplersquos house, which is taken inside overnight.Mario said: ldquoThe children love the lights.

title: british-empire-medal-honour-quizmaster-supported-good-causes-covid-19-pandemic
story: Andrew Wildgoose was named in the Queenrsquos New Yearrsquos Honours at the end of last year.East Lothianrsquos Lord Lieutenant Roderick Urquhart held an investiture at Mr Wildgoosersquos parentsrsquo home in Dunbar to present the award, where guests and family members were able to witness the ceremony.Mr Wildgoose, , said: ldquoIt was really special.ldquoIt was odd with being the honours in the new year and then  months later getting the medal.ldquoWe have been really busy and it was nice to have the whole team out and feel it was commemorated now, as we are coming to the end of what was a pretty awful  months.Mr Wildgoose, who previously stayed in Dunbar and now lives in Edinburgh, has for several years run quiz company Goosersquos Quizzes, based in the Capital.The business now employs a team who collectively oversee up to  weekly pub quizzes across the Central Belt.He received his BEM for services to charitable fundraising during the pandemic, when he adapted his business to provide home-based quizzes using an online streaming .After five months, the re-shaped company had delivered  online quizzes, having put together hundreds of quiz questions and marked thousands of answer sheets each week.The quiz attracts thousands of viewers from all over the world ndash mainly in the UK but also participants from as far afield as the USA, Kazakhstan and Greenland.There is no charge for the participants but players can donatethey are able to.Mr Wildgoose said they had now been able to take the quiz back to pubs and bars, rather than purely being behind computer screens.And he had been touched by the number of people who had come up to him to say how much the quizzes had helped during lockdown restrictions.His BEM citation included: ldquoIn developing an online version of the traditional pub quiz, families and friends who live apart can virtually group together and form a team to play along. In addition, there is an online chatwhich allows inidual participants to interact with the quiz hosts and other players, creating a much-needed social community, especially appreciated by those living alone.ldquoUnder his leadership, his entire Goosersquos Quizzes team have created an online community offering much-needed social contact during this dficult time.

title: pupils-elected-scottish-youth-parliament-east-lothian-midlothian-north-musselburgh
story: The Scottish Youth Parliament is a youth-led, democratic organisation which aims to represent the young people of Scotland, made up of about  democratically elected representatives aged ndash from across Scotland.Fraser Davidson and Daniel Scott, both , were elected as East Lothian members of the Scottish Youth Parliament, while Musselburgh resident Olivia Brown, , and Callum Gibson, , a pupil at Newbattle High School, will represent Midlothian North and Musselburgh.

title: east-lothian-peeps-past-november-22-26-1996-1971-1921
story: AN HISTORIC moment in the county took place, reported the East Lothian Courier on November , .The balloon went up on the new dual carriageway from Tranent to Haddington on Monday as Scottish Office Minister Lord James Douglas-Hamilton opened the road in spectacular style.Lord James rounded off the opening ceremony when he took the wheel of a JCB and used the digger to cut loose , colourful balloons attached to a rope.As the balloons floated off into the clear blue sky, Lord James and other dignitaries boarded a vintage bus for a tour of the new road.The charabanc, on loan from a transport museum in Dunfermline, was the first vehicle, apart from those belonging to the contractors, to drive on the new road.Others on board included East Lothian MP John Home Robertson, the Lord Lieutenant of East Lothian, Sir Hew Dalrymple, and assistant chief constable Tom Wood of Lothian and Borders Police.THE thespian talents of an East Lothian newsagent and his troupe were featured in The Haddingtonshire Courier on November , .When local newsagent Mr Alex Grandison took on the role of stage producer during Tranent Civic Week, the antics of his talented company, the Bankton Players, had the audience rolling in the aisles during the Late Nite Revue.It was then forecast that Tranent would likely want to see a lot more of them ndash resulting in a lot of hard work during the winter evenings.The prediction has almost been realised, for this week Mr Grandison admitted that he had chosen a play for his enthusiastic troupe.The play ldquoIrsquom not letting the cat out of the bag, said Mr Grandison.ldquoAnd thatrsquos not the name of the play.A FIRE at a farm in Elphinstone was reported on in The Haddingtonshire Courier on November , .An outbreak of fire occurred in the stackyard of North Elphinstone farm, on Monday afternoon, due to some children playing with matches.Mr Brooks at once telephoned for Haddington brigade.Some delay was experienced in obtaining horses to draw the steam fire engine and, before the brigade had got out of Haddington, its services were countermanded, as there as no ware on the farm.Fortunately, the fire by this time had been subdued by the farm servants by means of water buckets.A quantity of wheat was somewhat damaged.

title: reverse-advent-calendar-preston-lodge-high-school-calling-donations
story: Instead of opening the door of the Advent calender to reveal a chocolate, participants do the giving and donate items to East Lothian Sunday Fresh Chicken Dinner Boxes.The aim of the project is to provide a Christmas turkey dinner box to all those in need this winter.Items sought are: shortbread, mince pies, turkey gravy granules, Christmas crackers, small boxes of chocolate, boxes of biscuits, hot chocolate, spray cream, Christmas cake, ham stock cubes, tinfoil and oatcakes.Parents, carers or friends of the school can contribute to the collection by passing items to Mrs Robertsonrsquos office or by ringing the buzzer outside the school to alert a member of staff.Visitors are still unable to enter the school due to Covid- regulations, so a member of the office team will collect donations from the door.The school is also seeking sanitary products, toothbrushes and other toiletries to donate to Womenrsquos Aid.Julia Robertson, deputy headteacher at PLHS, said: ldquoWomenrsquos Aid are very grateful for our donations each year.ldquoThe Christmas period is a time when domestic violence increases and many women have to flee their homes without basic provisions.ldquoAny contributions would be very much appreciated and well used.

title: world-cup-draw-channel-time-watch-play-off-draw-today
story: Scotland isseeded for the semi finals of the play-offs, thanks to an impressive win over Denmark in their final Group F match.Steve Clarkes side joins Wales, Italy,Portugal,Russia and Sweden in the seeded spots, with these teams set to face one ofAustria, North Macedonia, Turkey, Poland, Ukraine or Czech Republic.With the play-offs scheduled for March , this afternoons draw will give us an idea of whats to come for the Scotland team as they try to move one step closer to World Cup qualication.Heres what you need to know about this afternoons World Cup play offdraw, including time and how to watch...The World Cup play offdraw will take place in Zurich, Switzerland at the Fa headquarterson Friday November  at pm UK time.The World Cup play off draw can be livestreamed on Fas official websitethisafternoon.Coverage will start at pm.The World Cup play offs are set to take place in March .The twelve teams in the draw will be ided into three groups to play semis and finals.Semi final matches will be played on March - , and finals on March - .The three winners of these finals will then qualy for the World Cup.Scotland, Portugal, Italy, Russia, Sweden and Wales are all seeded for the World Cup play offs.Scotland and the other seeded sides could be drawn against any of the following teams:The  World Cup will start on November  , with the final taking place on December  .This is later in the year than usual due to extremely high temperatures in Doha in the summer.

title: storm-arwen-a1-east-lothian-close-entirety-afternoon-due-extremely-strong-winds
story: The Met Office has issued its most serious red take action warning covering the period between pm today and am tomorrow , as it warns of a potential danger to le due to extremely strong winds.: Met Office warns of danger to le in East Lothian after issuing its most serious red warningThe A is now closed in both directions between Abbotsview Junction, Haddington, and Thistly Cross Roundabout, near West Barns.##UPDATE##:#AThe #A is now##CLOSED##to ALL vehicles between Haddington and Thistly Cross r about due to strong winds.A clearly signed ersion is in operation to use the #A instead@SETrunkRoads @RHANews @LogisticsUKNews pic OZFACBeDBEAR Scotland, Transport Scotlands operating company responsible for the A, had earlier said thatthe winds were as strong as forecast, it would bring in a full closure of the A in all affected areas.A ersion route is in place via the A. This is expected to add approximately  minutes to affected journeys.Traffic Scotland is also warning of a detached road sign near Bankton Junction obstructing traffic heading westbound near Tranent.Tommy Deans, BEAR Scotlandrsquos network manager for south-east Scotland, said: ldquoThis section of the A includes an exposed bridge over the River Tyne, so with gusts up to mph forecast this evening, wersquove closed it to all traffic for safety, in line with the bridgersquos wind management plan.At .pm, BEAR Scotland announced that the A had been closed to high-sided vehicles, with wind speeds of up to mph recorded near Torness.Drivers of high-sided vehicles, motorbikes, caravansand cars with trailers or roof boxes should ert via the A.Mr Deans said: ldquoWersquove now closed the A to high-sided vehicles for safety, with winds gusting over mph.ldquoAll road users are advised to take care and check for restrictions before travel."If we experience the very high wind speeds that are forecast later today, this will result in a full closure of the A.ldquoPlease check Traffic Scotland for the latest travel advice before setting off and consider whether your journey is essential.Police have said people should not drive "under any circumstances" while the red warning is in place.:Dont drive under any circumstances during red weather warning, police say# RED WIND WARNING #BEAR Scotland is warning road users to expect restrictions on high sided vehicles and a possible full closure of the #A later today when the strongest winds from #StormArwen arrive on the east coast of Scotland.More:https:t.co PPCSXso pic jQkHEvWith sleet and snow forecast on higher routes, BEAR Scotland will have  gritters treating trunk roads in south-east Scotland this evening and a further  on patrol overnight. Patrols will also monitor the Queensferry Crossing for ice.

title: storm-arwen-john-muir-country-park-completely-devastated
story: Ross Largue took a video at the popular country park, near Dunbar, this morning in the aftermath of the storm, which ripped through the county with winds approaching mph yesterday.@LothianLoop @BBCScotWeather John Muir country park in Dunbar completely devastated by #StormArwen pic HjiXsREast Lothian Council earlier said thatJohn Muir Country Park had been "particularly affected" by the storm.Nearby Foxlake Adventures also suffered serious damage, with a number of trees brought down and people urged to stay away from the area for their own safety.A statement on Foxlakes Facebook page said: "We have received serious damage to our wooded area and zip course through the night."We are appealing to all walkers and dog walkers to stay away from the area as it remains very dangerous."Across the county, trees have been brought down, many of them blocking roads, with council teams working to clear the debris and reopen the roads as soon as possible.Work is also ongoing to restore power to some eastern and rural parts of the county which have been witout power since yesterday evening.

title: pm-announces-new-travel-restrictions-response-omicron-variant
story: The PM announced the news during a Downing Street press conference today, after two cases of the concerning new Omicron iant were detected in the UK.He also announced that England will crack down on face mask rules making them mandatory in shops and on public transport ndash a measure which Scotland has had in place for several months.The new restrictions mean that Omicron contacts will have to self-isolate and new arrivals will have to quarantine until they test negative for coronavirus, but the measures will be reviewed in three weeks.:Two people in UK found to be infected by new Omicron iantMalawi, Mozambique, Zambia and Angola will now face travel restrictions from Sunday, when they will join South Africa and five other neighbouring nations on Englandrsquos red list.The travel restrictions are the same as the new testing regime that Scotland has said it is also adopting.Mr Johnson said the measures are ldquotemporary and precautionary, but those who are contacts with a suspected case of the new iant will have to isolate for  days, regardless of their vaccination status.He said: ldquoWe need to take targeted and proportionate measures now as a precaution while we find out more.ldquoFirst, we need to slow down the seeding of the iant in this country, we need to buy time for our scientists to understand exactly what wersquore dealing with, and for us to get more people vaccinated, and above all to get more people boosted.ldquoWe will also go further in asking all of you to help contain the spread of this iant by tightening up the rules on face coverings in shops and on public transport,:Deputy FM Swinney claims devolution at threat from Westminster Government rotten to the coreIt comes as two cases of Omicron were confirmed in England today.The UK Health Security Agency confirmed the cases, which are both believed to be connected and linked to travel to southern Africa, after genomic sequencing overnight.The iniduals and their households were ordered into self-isolation and targeted testing was being carried out in areas where they are thought to have been infectious.

title: put-christmas-tree
story: The date for putting up the Christmas tree tends to y from family to family, with some opting for an early start to the festivities, while others wait right until the last minute.But did you know theres a traditional date for putting up your tree Heres everything you need to know about when you should be putting up your Christmas tree...According to tradition in the UKyou should put your Christmas tree up around the beginning of advent, which is four Sundays before Christmas.This yearadvent will start on November , however lots of people will choose to wait until December .Roman Catholic tradition on the other hand is at the other end of the spectrum - waiting until Christmas eve to put up the tree.The Queen finishes "dressing" her tree on Christmas eve, with all the members of the Royal family joining in as a festive family activity.While there are dferent traditions, it is of course completely up to you when you choose to put up your tree and start celebrating the festive season!Again, according to tradition, you should take your tree down on the th day of Christmaswhich is January .The first day of Christmas is unsurprisinglyDecember  and traditionally is followed by  further days of celebration.January  marks the beginning of the Christian holiday Epiphany and superstition suggests it is "bad luck" to keep your decorationsup after this date.However last year many people around the country kept their Christmas lights up well into February to maintain some festive cheer during the post-Christmaslockdown.

title: world-cup-play-off-draw-date-time-watch
story: Thanks to Scotlands win against Denmarkin their final Group F match, they are seeded for the semi finals and will therefore face one ofAustria, North Macedonia, Turkey, Poland, Ukraine or Czech Republic.And Scotland arent the only UK-seeded side -Wales have also secured a seeded spot.With the play-offs taking place next March, the draw will help Steve Clarkes side to prepare for what lies aheadas they try to move one step closer to Dohas World Cup.Having made it through to the play-off stage of Euro  earlier this summer, the team will look to build on this experience and move forward to win those all-important seats on the plane to Doha.Heres what you need to know about the World Cup play offdraw on Friday...The World Cup play offdraw will take place in Zurich, Switzerland at the Fa headquarterson Friday November  at pm UK time.The World Cup play off draw can be livestreamed on Fas official website on Friday afternoon.Coverage will start at pm.The World Cup play offs are set to take place in March .The twelve teams in the draw will be ided into three groups to play semis and finals.Semi final matches will be played on March - , and finals on March - .The three winners of these finals will then qualy for the World Cup.Scotland, Portugal, Italy, Russia, Sweden and Wales are all seeded for the World Cup play offs.Scotland and the other seeded sides could be drawn against any of the following teams:The  World Cup will start on November  , with the final taking place on December  .This is later in the year than usual due to extremely high temperatures in Doha in the summer.
